precontext: Anna had always managed to keep a calm demeanor. Her friends often sought her advice when faced with dilemmas. Whether it was a complicated schedule or adjusting to new situations, Anna seemed to handle it all.
sentence: At times, she can be flexible.
meanings_considered: able to flex; able to bend easily
explanation:
• The precontext emphasizes Anna's ability to manage dilemmas and adjust to new situations, which strongly supports the meaning of "capable of being changed" (meaning 1).  
• The phrase "flexible" in the context of handling life challenges aligns naturally with adaptability, not physical bending.  
• There is no mention of physical objects, movement, or structure, making the physical bending interpretation (meaning 2) implausible in this context.

HOMONYM: flexible
